intro: Psychotria capitellata, commonly known as the "Cape Cod psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters at the tips of its branches. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth surface and a slightly glossy appearance. Psychotria capitellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and coastal areas.
